title: Ground News - To reduce injuries to cops and suspects, Torrance’s Gracie University brings Brazilian jiujitsu to police
text:
Summary by Ground News After the severe beating of Rodney King by officers in 1991, the Los Angeles Police Department brought in Ultimate Fighting Championship co-founder Rorion Gracie to teach tactics of Brazilian jiujitsu. The demand paved the way for Gracie Survival Tactics, a specialized law-enforcement training program now based in Torrance. The course aims to create a de-escalation culture among police departments.
